SiteNameAddress: Railway Station Interchange, Station Road, Corby, NN17 1NA
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2030. The site has been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of a mix of uses being deployed on site which reduces the developable area for housing (assuming 50dph) an alternative yield of 29 dwellings has been assumed.. Awaiting S106

SiteNameAddress: Beanfield School, off Glastonbury Road, Corby, NN18 0DJ
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: 80 new residential dwellings. Site is under construction at November 2017 pursuant to extant permission (no completions to date). At March 2018, 32 completions.

SiteNameAddress: Parkland Gateway, George Street, Corby, NN17 1QG
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Site previously assessed through SHLAA as site 2037. The site was previously been subject to a bid to the HCA for Starter Homes funding and it was assumed that 40 dwellings could be delivered on the site. However, as part of an urban design review, consideration was also made of higher densities (flats) being deployed on site and assuming 100dph an alternative yield of 63 dwellings has been assumed.

SiteNameAddress: Kingswood School, Gainsborough Road, Corby, NN18 9NQ
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Erection of up to 131 no. dwellings, provision of open space and works.. Site is under construction at November 2017 pursuant to extant permission (12 dwellings completed to date, 10 starts). At March 2018, 57 completions.

SiteNameAddress: Scott Road Garages, Scott Road, Kettering, NN16 9JY
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 705. Council owned site. Preference would be for affordable housing on site. Different dwelling capaciites have been calculated for the site dependent on potential densities to be applied (taking account of the surrounding area). These entail either 17 houses at 50dph or 12 houses at 35 dph and these values take account (exclude) an area of the site under which a sewer easement runs.. A sewer easement crosses the site.

SiteNameAddress: Desborough Leisure Centre, Off Broadlands, Desborough, NN14 2YH
OwnershipStatus: owned by a public authority
Notes: For BFR assessment purposes it is assumed that development will only happen on the PDL element of site (and not the larger, wider site which includes extensive tracts of Greenfield). To derive these estimates it has been calculated that only 30% of the wider site is PDL so 70% of the overall site has been discounted for development, hence the minimum figure propsed of 46 net dwellings used.. KET/2016/0044 - Residential development up to 304 dwellings - Outline. Appeal allowed. (APP/L2820/W/16/3162430). Previously assessed through SHLAA as site 1165. http://www.nnjpu.org.uk/publications/docdetail.asp?docid=1323

SiteNameAddress: Site G TCAAP - Alma St/Cambridge Street Backlands, Cambridge Street, Wellingborough, NN8 4DJ
OwnershipStatus: not owned by a public authority
Notes: WP/15/0092/FUL - Erection of a terrace of five 2-storey houses with room in the roof and associated works. WP/15/00094/FUL - Conversion of upper floor to 5 self-contained residential units and the change of use of ground floor from D2 use class to D1 use class (non-residential Community Centre). Associated external alterations to the building. WP/16/00682/FUL - Conversion of ground and lower floors of former Working Mens Club to form four two-bed and one one-bed flats. ADDITIONAL BIN STORAGE (this permission partially supersedes WP/15/00094/FUL). The five dwelling units pursuant to WP/15/00092/FUL were completed in June 2016 and are located at the rear of the working mens club. The 5 self-contained residential units pursuant to WP/15/00094/FUL were completed in September 2016. Works relating to WP/16/00682/FUL commenced in August 2017.
